entries.meaning: The state of being sleepy and inactive.

verbs.description: drowse (third-person singular simple present drowses, present participle drowsing, simple past and past participle drowsed)

entries.meaning: (intransitive, also figurative) To be sleepy and inactive.
examples: In August the cicadas chorused, and the dusty olive trees drowsed in the sun.

entries.meaning: (intransitive) To nod off; to fall asleep.
(transitive) To advance drowsily. (Used especially in the phrase "drowse one's way" â‡’ sleepily make one's way.)
examples: [â€¦]  the wary tadpole returned from exile, the bullfrog resumed his ancient song, the tranquil turtle sunned his back upon bank and log and drowsed his grateful life away as in the old sweet days of yore.

entries.meaning: (transitive) To make heavy with sleepiness or imperfect sleep; to make dull or stupid.
